text: Robert Adam Ross Maclennan, Baron Maclennan of Rogart (26 June 1936 – 18 January 2020) was a British politician and life peer. He was the last leader of the Social Democratic Party (SDP) from 1987 to 1988. He was the president of the Liberal Democrats from 1995 to 1998. He served as a Member of Parliament (MP) from 1966 to 2001, when he was raised to the House of Lords. Maclennan was born in Glasgow. His father was Sir Hector MacLennan. He died in January 2020, at the age of 83. ==References== Category:1936 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Alumni of the University of Cambridge Category:Alumni of the University of Oxford Category:Columbia University alumni Category:Labour Party (UK) MPs Category:Liberal Democrats (UK) MPs Category:Members of the British House of Commons for Scottish constituencies Category:Leaders of the Liberal Democrats (UK) Category:Leaders of the Social Democratic Party (UK) Category:Liberal Democrat Life Peers Category:Politicians from Glasgow Category:Members of the Privy Council of the United Kingdom Category:Social Democratic Party (UK) MPs Category:UK MPs 1966–1970 Category:UK MPs 1970–1974 Category:UK MPs 1974 Category:UK MPs 1974–1979 Category:UK MPs 1979–1983 Category:UK MPs 1983–1987 Category:UK MPs 1987–1992 Category:UK MPs 1992–1997 Category:UK MPs 1997–2001
title: Robert Maclennan, Baron Maclennan of Rogart
